sen.j: 鬘能（かづらのう、かつらのう）とは、能の演目の中で、優美な女性や貴公子、天人などがシテの曲。
sen.e: Kazura Noh is one of the programs of Noh theatrical performance, when Shite (doers) performs the roles of a beautiful woman, a scion of a noble family, or a heavenly being,
Kazura Noh is one of the programs of Noh theatrical performance, when the shite (the main actor of a Noh play) performs the roles of a beautiful woman, a scion of a noble family, or a heavenly being.
sen.cmt: シテ 説明を他の記事と統一しました。カンマ→ピリオドに変更しました。
sen.e: Kazura Noh is one of the programs of Noh theatrical performance, when the shite (the main actor of a Noh play) performs the roles of a beautiful woman, a scion of a noble family, or a heavenly being.
The program is also called Kazuramono.
The program is also called Kazura-mono.
sen.cmt: ハイフンを追加しました。
sen.e: The program is also called Kazura-mono.

sen.j: 能上演形式において三番目物となる。
sen.e: This program is the third performance among five Noh performances defined in the form of Noh program.
It is sanbanme-mono (third-category plays) according to the style of Noh performance.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: It is sanbanme-mono (third-category plays) according to the style of Noh performance.

sen.j: 『源氏物語』や『伊勢物語』に取材したものが多い。
sen.e: The stories of Kazura Noh are often taken from "Genji Monogatari" (The tale of Genji) or "Ise Monogatari." (The tale of Ise)
The stories of Kazura Noh are often taken from "Genji Monogatari" (The tale of Genji) or "Ise Monogatari" (The tale of Ise).
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を変更しました。
sen.e: The stories of Kazura Noh are often taken from "Genji Monogatari" (The tale of Genji) or "Ise Monogatari" (The tale of Ise).

sen.j: 源氏物語に取材したもの
sen.e: Those performances taken from Genji Monogatari
Those taken from Genji Monogatari
Those taken from Genji Monogatari

sen.j: 『半蔀』『夕顔』『野宮』『住吉詣』『落葉』『源氏供養』（『松風 (能)』）
sen.e: "Hajitomi" from the chapter "Yugao" ("Evening Faces"/"Twighlight Beauty") "Yugao" "Nonomiya" from the chapter "Sakaki" ("Sacred Tree"/"Green Branch") "Sumiyoshimoude" ("Channel Buoys"/"Pilgrimage to Sumiyoshi") "Ochiba" from the chapter "Yugiri" ("Evening Mist") "Genji Kuyo" "Matsukaze" from the chapter "Suma"

"Hajitomi" (Lattice Shutter), "Yugao" (Evening Faces), "Nonomiya" (Field Palace), "Sumiyoshimode" (Visit to Sumiyoshi Shrine), "Ochiba" (Fallen Leaves), "Genji Kuyo" (Buddhist ceremonies for Murasaki Shikibu's souls), "Matsukaze (Noh)" (Wind in the Pines)
sen.cmt: 演目名及び英訳を表記しました （定訳不明です）。
sen.e: "Hajitomi" (Lattice Shutter), "Yugao" (Evening Faces), "Nonomiya" (Field Palace), "Sumiyoshimode" (Visit to Sumiyoshi Shrine), "Ochiba" (Fallen Leaves), "Genji Kuyo" (Buddhist ceremonies for Murasaki Shikibu's souls), "Matsukaze (Noh)" (Wind in the Pines)

sen.j: 伊勢物語に取材したもの
sen.e: Those performances taken from Ise Monogatari
Those taken from Ise Monogatari
Those taken from Ise Monogatari
"Izutsu""Kakitsubata"(Iris) "Urin-in"
"Izutsu (Noh)" (The Well Cradle), "Kakitsubata" (Iris), "Unrinin" (Unrin-in Temple)
sen.cmt: 演目名及び英訳を表記しました （定訳不明です）。
sen.e: "Izutsu (Noh)" (The Well Cradle), "Kakitsubata" (Iris), "Unrinin" (Unrin-in Temple)
Others
Others
Others

sen.j: 『羽衣』『胡蝶』『楊貴妃』『草子洗小町』『関寺小町』『東北』『定家』『誓願寺』『檜垣』『采女』『大原御幸』『祇王』『仏原』『熊野』『千手』『二人静』『吉野静』『江口』『遊行柳』『六浦』『藤』『芭蕉』
sen.e: "Hagoromo"(Celestial Robe) "Kocho" "Yokihi" (Consort Yáng Guifei) "Sohshi Arai Komachi" "Sekidera Komachi" "Toboku" "Teika" "Sengan-ji" "Higaki" "Uneme" "Ohara Goko" "Gioh" "Hotokenohara" "Yuya" (from "Heike Monogatari" ("The tale of Heike")) "Senjyu" (from "Heike Monogatari") "Futari Shizuka" (from "Gikeiki" ("The tale of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune"))"Yoshino Shizuka" (from "Gikeiki") "Eguchi" "Yugyo Yanagi" "Mutsura" "Fuji" "Basho"

"Hagoromo" (Celestial Robe), "Kocho" (Butterflies), "Yokihi" (Consort Yáng Guifei), "Soshi Arai Komachi" (Komachi Washing the Manuscript), "Sekidera Komachi" (Komachi at Seki-dera Temple), "Toboku" (Toboku-in Temple), "Teika" (FUJIWARA no Teika), "Sengan-ji" (Sengan-ji Temple), "Higaki" (Cypress Fence), "Uneme" (A Court Lady), "Ohara Goko" (The Emperor's Trip to Ohara), "Gio," "Hotoke no hara" (The Courtesan on Buddha Plain), "Yuya" (The Courtesan Yuya), "Senju," "Futari Shizuka" (The Two Shizukas), "Yoshino Shizuka" (Shizuka at Yoshino), "Eguchi" (Port of Eguchi), "Yugyo Yanagi" (The Priest and the Willow), "Mutsura" (In the Village of Mutsura), "Fuji" (The Spirit of the Wisteria), "Basho" (The Basho Tree)
